info.name: Verizon
info.description: The Verizon Edge Discovery Service API can direct your application clients to connect to the optimal service endpoints for your Multi-access Edge Computing (MEC) applications for every session. The Edge Discovery Service takes into account the current location of a device, its IP anchor location, current network traffic and other factors to determine which 5G Edge platform a device should connect to.

item.name: 5G Edge Platforms
item.description: Discover the regions in the 5G Edge service and find the optimal MEC platforms for your Edge applications.

query.description: MEC region name. Current valid values are US_WEST_2 and US_EAST_1.
Unique identifier of the service profile.
Minimum number of 4G/5G subscribers per square kilometer.
Type of User Equipment identifier used in `UEIdentity`.
The identifier value for User Equipment. The type of identifier is defined by the 'UEIdentityType' parameter. The`IPAddress`format can be IPv4 or IPv6.

request.description: Returns a list of optimal MEC Platforms where you can register your deployed application. **Note:** If a query is sent with all of the parameters, it will fail with a "400" error. You can search based on the following parameter combinations - region plus Service Profile ID and subscriber density (density is optional but recommended), region plus UEIdentity(Including UEIdentity Type) or Service Profile ID plus UEIdentity(Including UEIdentity Type).
List the geographical regions available, based on the user's bearer token. **Note:** Country code, Metropolitan area, Area and Zone are future functionality and will currently return a "null" value.

item.name: Service Endpoints
item.description: Register the routable endpoints of your deployed Edge application services. After registering, use service endpoint discovery to find the optimal service endpoints for application clients to connect to for each session.

query.description: MEC region name. Current valid values are US_WEST_2 and US_EAST_1.
Minimum number of 4G/5G subscribers per square kilometer.
Type of User Equipment identifier used in `UEIdentity`.
The identifier value for User Equipment. The type of identifier is defined by the 'UEIdentityType' parameter. The`IPAddress`format can be IPv4 or IPv6.
A system-defined string identifier representing one or more registered Service Endpoints.

request.description: Returns a list of optimal Service Endpoints that client devices can connect to. **Note:** If a query is sent with all of the parameters, it will fail with a "400" error. You can search based on the following parameter combinations - Region plus Service Endpoints IDs and Subscriber density (density is optional but recommended), Region plus Service Endpoints IDs and UEIdentity(Including UEIdentity Type) and Service Endpoints IDs plus UEIdentity(Including UEIdentity Type).

response.status: An array of optimal Service Endpoint IDs for clients to connect to.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Register Service Endpoints of a deployed application to specified MEC Platforms.
Returns a list of all registered service endpoints.

response.status: Returns a comma delimited list of all registered service endpoints.
response.name: Response_200

variable.description: A system-defined string identifier representing one or more registered Service Endpoints.

request.description: Returns endpoint information for all Service Endpoints registered to a specified serviceEndpointId.

response.status: Registered service endpoint information for a 5G Edge service.
response.name: Response_200

variable.description: A system-defined string identifier representing one or more registered Service Endpoints.

request.description: Update registered Service Endpoint information.

variable.description: A system-defined string identifier representing one or more registered Service Endpoints.

request.description: Deregister an application's Service Endpoint from the MEC Platform(s).

item.name: Service Profiles
item.description:
Create and manage profiles that describe the service characteristics of your 5G Edge applications, such as the required connection bandwidth andmaximum latency.
**Note:** For the initial release of the Edge Discovery Service API,`latency`is the only service profile property that is compared with 5G Edge platform capabilities.

request.description: Creates a service profile that describes the resource requirements of a service.
List all service profiles registered under your API key.

response.status: A comma delimited list of all the service profiles registered under your API key.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Returns a specified service profile.
Update the definition of a Service Profile.
Delete Service Profile based on unique service profile ID.

item.name: Device Management
item.description: Manage device connectivity and get device history.

request.description: If the devices do not already exist in the account, this API resource adds them before activation.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Use this API if you want to manage some device settings before you are ready to activate service for the devices.

response.status: For each device in the request, contains device identifiers and a success or failure response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Sends a CarrierService callback message for each device in the request when the contact information has been changed, or if there was a problem and the change could not be completed.

response.status: Request ID returned in a success response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Sends a CarrierService callback message for each device in the request when the custom fields have been changed, or if there was a problem and the change could not be completed.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Deactivating service for a device may result in an early termination fee (ETF) being charged to the account, depending on the terms of the contract with Verizon. If your contract allows ETF waivers and if you want to use one for a particular deactivation, set the etfWaiver value to True.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Use this API to remove unneeded devices from an account.

response.status: For each device in the request, contains device identifiers and a success or failure response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Returns information about a single device or information about all devices that match the given parameters. Returned information includes device provisioning state, service plan, MDN, MIN, and IP address.

response.status: List of devices that match the request parameters, ordered by device creation date, oldest first.
response.name: Response_200

response.status: List of devices that match the request parameters, ordered by device creation date, oldest first. Additional devices remain.
response.name: Response_202

request.description: Returns a list of all 4G devices with an ICCID (SIM) that was not activated with the expected IMEI (hardware) during a specified time frame.

response.status: List of devices that have mismatched IMEIs and ICCIDs.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Move active devices from one billing account to another within a customer profile.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Changes the provisioning state of one or more devices to a specified customer-defined service and state.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Changes the service plan for one or more devices.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Suspends service for one or more devices.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Restores service to one or more suspended devices.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Checks whether specified devices are registered by the manufacturer with the Verizon network and are available to be activated.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Each response includes a maximum of 500 records. To obtain more records, you can call the API multiple times, adjusting the earliest value each time to start where the previous request finished.

response.status: List of device connection events, sorted by the occurredAt timestamp, oldest first.
response.name: Response_200

response.status: List of device connection events, sorted by the occurredAt timestamp, oldest first. Additional events remain.
response.name: Response_202

request.description: Changes or removes the CostCenterCode value or customer name and address (Primary Place of Use) for one or more devices.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Returns extended diagnostic information about a specified device, including connectivity, provisioning, billing and location status.
Returns the provisioning history of a specified device during a specified time period.

response.status: List of Device Provision History events, sorted by the timestamp, oldest first.
response.name: Response_200

response.status: List of Device Provision History events, sorted by the timestamp, oldest first. Additional events remain.
response.name: Response_202

request.description: 4G and GSM devices do not have a PRL.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Returns DeviceSuspensionStatus callback messages containing the current device state and information on how many days a device has been suspended and can continue to be suspended.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Returns the network data usage history of a device during a specified time period.

response.status: List of device usage events, sorted by the timestamp, oldest first.
response.name: Response_200

response.status: List of device usage events, sorted by the timestamp, oldest first. Additional events remain.
response.name: Response_202

request.description: The information is returned in a callback response, so you must register a URL for DeviceUsage callback messages using the POST /callbacks API.

response.status: A unique string that associates the request with the results that are sent via a callback service.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Changes the identifier of a 3G or 4G device to match hardware changes made for a line of service. Use this request to transfer the line of service and the MDN to new hardware, or to change the MDN.

response.status: A unique string that associates the request with the results that are sent via a callback service.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: This corresponds to the M2M-MC SOAP interface, ```DeviceUploadService```.
Gets billed usage for for either multiple devices or an entire billing account.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Allows you to associate your own usage segmentation label with a device.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

query.description: The numeric name of the account.
A list of the Label IDs to remove from the exclusion list.

request.description: Allow customers to remove the associated label from a device.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Uploads and activates device identifiers and SKUs for new devices from OEMs to Verizon.

request.description: Checks the status of an activation order and lists where the order is in the provisioning process.

item.name: Accounts
item.description: Get information about an account or account leads.

request.description: Returns information about a specified account.

response.name: Response_200

request.description: Returns a list and details of all custom services and states defined for a specified account.

response.status: The account's engagements, services, and states.
response.name: Response_200

query.description: Continue the previous query from the pageUrl in Location Header.

request.description: When HTTP status is 202, a URL will be returned in the Location header of the form /leads/{aname}?next={token}. This URL can be used to request the next set of leads.

response.status: The list of leads associated with the account.
response.name: Response_200

response.status: The list of leads associated with the account, additional leads remain.
response.name: Response_202

item.name: Device Groups
item.description: Manage device groups.

request.description: Create a new device group and optionally add devices to the group. Device groups can make it easier to manage similar devices and to get reports on their usage.

response.status: Successful response, Creates a new device group.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Returns a list of all device groups in a specified account.

response.status: The list of device groups in the account.
response.name: Response_200

query.description: Continue the previous query from the pageUrl pagetoken.

request.description: When HTTP status is 202, a URL will be returned in the Location header of the form /groups/{aname}/name/{gname}/?next={token}. This URL can be used to request the next set of groups.

response.name: Response_200
Response_202

body.raw: {"newGroupName":"Western region tanks","newGroupDescription":"All western region tank level monitors.","devicesToAdd":[{"kind":"imei","id":"990003420535537"}]}

request.description: Make changes to a device group, including changing the name and description, and adding or removing devices.
Deletes a device group from the account. Devices in the group are moved to the default device group and are not deleted from the account.

item.name: SMS
item.description: Exchange Short Message Service (SMS) messages with devices.

body.raw: {"servicePlan":"T Plan 2","smsMessage":"The rain in Spain stays mainly in the plain."}

request.description: The messages are queued on the ThingSpace Platform and sent as soon as possible, but they may be delayed due to traffic and routing considerations.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

query.description: Continue the previous query from the URL in Location Header.

request.description: When HTTP status is 202, a URL will be returned in the Location header of the form /sms/{aname}/history?next={token}. This URL can be used to request the next set of messages.

response.status: Successful response, additional SMS messages remain.
response.name: Response_202

request.description: Tells the ThingSpace Platform to start sending mobile-originated SMS messages through the EnhancedConnectivityService callback service. SMS messages from devices are queued until they are retrieved by your application, either by callback or synchronously with GET /sms/{accountName}/history.

item.name: Session Management
item.description: Start and end Connectivity Management sessions.

request.description: Initiates a Connectivity Management session and returns a VZ-M2M session token that is required in subsequent API requests.
Ends a Connectivity Management session.
The new password is effective immediately. Passwords do not expire, but Verizon recommends changing your password every 90 days.

response.status: Returns a new, randomly generated password for the current username.
response.name: Response_200

item.name: Connectivity Callbacks
item.description: Manage subscriptions to asynchronous webhook messages.

request.description: Returns the name and endpoint URL of the callback listening services registered for a given account.
You are responsible for creating and running a listening process on your server at that URL.

response.status: A success response for registering a callback.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Stops ThingSpace from sending callback messages for the specified account and service.

response.status: Response for a request to deregister a callback.
response.name: Response_200

item.name: Account Requests
item.description: Get the status of asynchronous reqeusts.

request.description: Returns the current status of an asynchronous request that was made for a single device.

item.name: Service Plans
item.description: Get a list of service plans in an account.

request.description: Returns a list of all data service plans that are associated with a specified billing account. When you send a request to /devices/actions/activate to activate a line of service you must specify the code for one of the service plans associated with your account.

response.status: The list of service plans associated with the account.
response.name: Response_200

item.name: Device Diagnostics
item.description: Helps to create & manage diagnostics

request.description: If the devices do not already exist in the account, this API resource adds them before activation.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Retrieve all the active monitors.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

body.raw: {"devices":[{"deviceIds":[{"id":"32-digit EID","kind":"eid"},{"id":"15-digit IMEI","kind":"imei"}]}],"accountName":"0000123456-00001","servicePlan":"The service plan name","mdnZipCode":"five digit zip code"}

request.description: Uses the profile to bring the device under management.
Uses the profile to activate the device.
Uses the profile to deactivate the device.
Allows the profile to set the fallback attribute to the device.

query.description: The numeric name of the account.
The array contains the monitorIDs (UUID) for which the monitor is to be deleted.

request.description: Downloads an eUICC local profile to devices and enables the profile.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Downloads an eUICC local profile to devices and leaves the profile disabled.

response.status: Request ID received on a successful response.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Enable a local profile that has been downloaded to eUICC devices.
Disable a local profile on eUICC devices. The default or boot profile will become the enabled profile.
Delete a local profile from eUICC devices. If the local profile is enabled, it will first be disabled and the boot or default profile will be enabled.

item.name: Devices Locations
item.description: Locate devices.

request.description: This locations endpoint retrieves the locations for a list of devices.

response.status: List of JSON objects, each containing the position data or an error for a device in the request.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Requests the current or cached location of up to 10,000 IoT or consumer devices (phones, tablets. etc.). This request returns a synchronous transaction ID, and the location information for each device is returned asynchronously as a DeviceLocation callback message.

response.status: Request accepted; location report in progress
response.name: Response_200

query.description: Account identifier in "##########-#####".

variable.description: Transaction ID of the request to cancel, from the synchronous response to the original request.

request.description: Cancel a queued or unfinished device location request.
Request an asynchronous device location report.

response.status: Request accepted; location report in progress.
response.name: Response_200

variable.description: Zero-based number of the first record to return.

request.description: Download a completed asynchronous device location report.

response.status: Location information for up to 1,000 devices.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Returns the current status of a requested device location report.

variable.description: Transaction ID of the report to cancel.

request.description: Cancel a queued device location report.

item.name: Exclusions
item.description: Exclude devices from location services.

request.description: This consents endpoint sets a new exclusion list.

query.description: The numeric name of the account.
A list of the device IDs to remove from the exclusion list.

request.description: Removes devices from the exclusion list so that they can be located with Device Location Services requests.

response.name: Response_400

variable.description: Zero-based number of the first record to return.

request.description: This consents endpoint retrieves a list of excluded devices in an account.

response.name: Response_400

item.name: Devices Location Subscriptions
item.description: Get an account's location service subscription status and usage.

request.description: This subscriptions endpoint retrieves an account's current location subscription status.

response.name: Response_400

request.description: This endpoint allows user to search for billable usage for accounts based on the provided date range.

response.name: Response_400

item.name: Device Location Callbacks
item.description: Receive notifications from the API.

request.description: Returns a list of all registered callback URLs for the account.

response.status: List of all registered callback URLs.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Provide a URL to receive messages from a ThingSpace callback service.
Deregister a URL to stop receiving callback messages.
Create a new usage trigger, which will send an alert when the number of device location service transactions reaches a specified percentage of the monthly subscription amount.
Update an existing usage trigger
eletes the specified usage trigger from the given account
This endpoint allows user to add managed accounts to a primary account.
Activates a managed billing service relationship between a managed account and the primary account.

response.name: Response_400

request.description: Deactivates a managed billing service relationship between a managed account and the primary account.

response.name: Response_400

request.description: This endpoint allows user to retrieve the list of all accounts managed by a primary account.

response.name: Response_400

item.name: Software Management Subscriptions V1
item.description: View Software Management Services subscription status.

request.description: This subscriptions endpoint retrieves an account's current Software Management Service subscription status.

variable.description: The zero-based number of the first record to return. Set startIndex=0 for the first request. If there are more than 1,000 devices in the response, set startIndex=1000 for the second request, 2000 for the third request, etc.

request.description: Returns information about an account's Software Management Services licenses and a list of licensed devices.

item.name: Software Management Licenses V1
item.description: Assign Software Management Services license to devices **Note:**These endpoints have been deprecated. Please use the **v3** endpoints.

request.description: Assigns licenses to a specified list of devices so that firmware upgrades can be scheduled for those devices.
Remove unused licenses from device.

response.status: List of devices with license removal status.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Creates a list of devices from which licenses will be removed if the number of MRC licenses becomes less than the number of assigned licenses.
Deletes the entire list of cancellation candidate devices.

variable.description: The zero-based number of the first record to return. Set startIndex=0 for the first request. If there are more than 1,000 devices in the response, set startIndex=1000 for the second request, 2000 for the third request, etc.

request.description: Returns a list of devices from which licenses will be removed if the number of MRC licenses becomes less than the number of assigned licenses.

item.name: Firmware V1
item.description: Schedule and monitor firmware upgrades.

request.description: Lists all device firmware images available for an account, based on the devices registered to that account.
Schedules a firmware upgrade for devices.

variable.description: The UUID of the upgrade, returned by POST /upgrades when the upgrade was scheduled.

request.description: Returns information about a specified upgrade, include the target date of the upgrade, the list of devices in the upgrade, and the status of the upgrade for each device.

variable.description: The UUID of the upgrade, returned by POST /upgrades when the upgrade was scheduled.

request.description: Add or remove devices from a scheduled upgrade.

response.name: Response_200

variable.description: The UUID of the scheduled upgrade that you want to cancel.

request.description: Cancel a scheduled firmware upgrade.

item.name: Software Management Callbacks V1
item.description: Register and deregister callback endpoints.

request.description: Returns the name and endpoint URL of the callback listening services registered for a given account.
Registers a URL to receive RESTful messages from a callback service when new firmware versions are available and when upgrades start and finish.

variable.description: Callback type. Must be 'Fota' for Software Management Services API.

request.description: Deregisters the callback endpoint and stops ThingSpace from sending FOTA callback messages for the specified account.

item.name: Software Management Reports V1
item.description: Status and history information.

variable.description: Only return devices with IMEIs larger than this value. Use 0 for the first request. If `hasMoreData`=true in the response, use the `lastSeenDeviceId` value from the response as the startIndex in the next request.

request.description: Returns an array of all devices in the specified account. Each device object includes information needed for managing firmware, including the device make and model, MDN and IMEI, and current firmware version.

variable.description: The status of the upgrades that you want to retrieve.

The zero-based number of the first record to return. Set startIndex=0 for the first request. If `hasMoreFlag`=true in the response, use the `lastSeenUpgradeId` value from the response as the startIndex in the next request.

request.description: Returns a list of all upgrades with a specified status.

response.status: A list of all upgrades with a specified status.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: Returns the upgrade history of the specified device from the previous six months.

item.name: Campaigns V2
item.description: Schedule, retreive or cancel scheduled FOTA campaigns.

request.description: This endpoint allows user to schedule a software upgrade.
This endpoint allows user to get information of a software upgrade.
This endpoint allows user to Add or Remove devices to an existing software upgrade.

response.status: Result of adding or removing devices to existing software upgrade information.
response.name: Response_200

request.description: This endpoint allows user to cancel software upgrade. A software upgrade already started can not be cancelled.
This endpoint allows user to change campaign dates and time windows. Fields which need to remain unchanged should be also provided.
You can upload configuration files and schedule them in a campaign to devices.
Campaign time windows for downloading and installing software are available as long as the device OEM supports this.

This endpoint allows user to create the HTTPS callback address.
This endpoint allows user to delete a previously registered callback URL.

item.description: Status of a campaign per device.

header.description: This is the Basic (authentication) token for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Portal (thingspace.verizon.com).
This is the UWS login name for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).
This is the UWS password for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).

request.description: With this API call the users (clients) register themselves as Vendors to the IMP system. Therefore, when a registration is initiated from a device or software service to the IMP system with the registered VendorID, then the client registration will be authorized.

query.description: The VendorID set during the Vendor registration call.

header.description: This is the Basic (authentication) token for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Portal (thingspace.verizon.com).
This is the UWS login name for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).
This is the UWS password for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).

request.description: With this API call the users (clients) can unregister themselves from the IMP system. The devices and services for this Vendor will no longer be able to use the IMP Message Exchange.

header.description: This is the UWS login name for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).
This is the UWS password for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).

request.description:
With this API call the user (client) registers its device or software service to the IMP system. Therefore, when a connection is initiated from the device or software service to the IMP system along with the credential provided by this registration call, then the connection will be authorized.
Note 1: One user can register multiple devices or software services, which can all be used at the same time.

Note 2: The user needs to authenticate with their ThingSpace credentials and request a bearer token in order to call this API.

query.description: The Device IDs acquired through the registration API.

header.description: This is the UWS login name for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).
This is the UWS password for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).

request.description: With this API call the user (client) can unregister its devices and software services from the IMP system. The unregistered devices and services will no longer be able to use the IMP Message Exchange.

header.description: This is the UWS login name for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).
This is the UWS password for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).
The VendorID set during the Vendor registration call.

request.description:
With this API call the  or software service requests the MQTT URL for the location that it needs to connect. To determine the proper URL the device or software service needs to provide its ID (the one that was provided in the registration request), location (GPS coordinates), and whether it is on the Verizon cellular network or not.

Note: The user needs to authenticate with their ThingSpace credentials and request a bearer token in order to call this API.

header.description: This is the Basic (authentication) token for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Portal (thingspace.verizon.com).

This is the UWS password for the user. It should be acquired by using the ThingSpace Connectivity Management Portal (thingspace.verizonwireless.com).
